alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 8:05AM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Ojo Caliente Below La Madera affecting Rio Arriba County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rio Ojo Caliente below La Madera. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Farm and pasture land is being inundated, and irrigation channels and gates may be severly damaged if high flows persist. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM MDT Friday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM MDT Friday was 7.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 7.2 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.3 feet on 06/19/1966. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Rio Ojo Caliente La Madera 7.0 7.2 Fri 7 am MDT 7.1 7.1 7.1 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this evening around 1000 PM MDT.
